Problem 90. Suppose that A ⊂ Z/pZ is a set of density 1/2. Under what conditions on K can A be almost invariant under all maps ϕ(x) = ax + b, |a|, |b| ⩽ K?

Comments. This problem was considered by Eberhard, Mrazović and me (unpublished). By ‘almost invariant’ we mean |A △ ϕ(A)| = o(p). One can have K → ∞
